Instruction: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
Add the green beans to the boiling water and blanch for 2-3 minutes, until bright green and slightly tender.
Drain the green beans and transfer them to a bowl of ice water to stop the cooking process. Drain again.
In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add minced garlic to the skillet and saute for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
Add the blanched green beans to the skillet and toss to coat in the garlic butter.
Sprinkle grated Parmesan cheese, salt,  and black pepper over the green beans and toss again to coat evenly.
Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until the green beans are heated through and the cheese is melted.
Remove from heat and serve hot as a flavorful side dish.
